name: I. Project Overview
content:
Objective

The primary objective of this project is to analyze the impact of marketing expenditures on sales performance by incorporating the concept of adstock effects. Adstock analysis accounts for the lagged and diminishing effect of advertising over time, allowing businesses to measure not just the immediate but also the residual influence of media investments.

This project addresses the business problem of how to allocate marketing budgets effectively across different channels (TV, radio, print, digital, etc.) to maximize sales outcomes.

Approach

  1. Data Understanding and Profiling – Explore the advertising dataset, including spend across channels and corresponding sales outcomes.
  2. Data Preparation – Clean, transform, and engineer features such as lagged adstock variables to capture carryover effects.
  3. Model Training – Build statistical and machine learning models (e.g., regression with adstock transformation, regularized regression) to quantify relationships between ad spends and sales.
  4. Evaluation and Validation – Use appropriate metrics to evaluate model accuracy and reliability in predicting sales.
  5. Insights and Recommendations – Derive actionable insights for marketing budget optimization and channel strategy.

Significance

This project is significant because marketing budgets are often one of the largest expenses for consumer-facing businesses. By quantifying the true ROI of each channel (including long-term effects), companies can move from intuition-driven marketing to data-driven decision-making. This ensures smarter budget allocation, improved campaign performance, and measurable impact on revenue.


Benefits

  • Financial: Improved ROI through optimized media spend.
  • Operational: Data-driven marketing allocation reduces waste and duplication of effort.
  • Strategic: Clear understanding of channel effectiveness strengthens marketing strategy.
  • Predictive Capability: Ability to forecast future sales under different budget allocation scenarios.

Expected Outcomes

  • Quantitative estimates of short-term and long-term advertising effects across channels.
  • Ranked importance of each marketing channel in driving sales.
  • Optimized budget allocation strategies for maximum ROI.
  • Predictive model capable of simulating sales outcomes under different ad spend scenarios.
